Reviews.Title: “in the middle of Paris”
Reviews.Author: mabra21
Reviews.Content: Very close to Metro Franklin Roosevelt you find this amazing hotel just some walking minutes from the fashion and Champs life. The rooms are between historic and modern - historic environment with modern bed and bathroom. The elevator seems to bee too small for wheelchairs. The breakfast is french - very nice croissant.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel, great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: suitcaseinhandBoston
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the West End and it was a truly wonderful experience. The room furnishings were lovely, the beds comfortable, the marble bathroom exquisite, the staff was always helpful and friendly, and the location was terrific. The neighborhood has many cafes and shops, and even a supermarket within a three block radius, while still offering a quiet, residential setting. It is a five minute walk to the Avenue des Champs-Élysées and a number of metro lines that connected us to all the city had to offer. It is also 10-15 minute walking distance to the Eiffell Tower. We definitely plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid two-day break”
Reviews.Author: GillR72
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the West-End Hotel in Paris. The location was superb - very central, yet tucked a few streets away from the Champs Elysee, so we had the best of both worlds as it was also quiet. The service we received from the staff prior to our stay was brilliant - we received restaurant recommendations and all enquires were replied to most promptly. We took previous guests' advice and had breakfast in our room - the room reserved for breakfast was fairly small - room service was superb! We were lucky to have one of the Deluxe rooms which was pretty large (especially for Paris) and the decor was tasteful and fresh. The bathroom was lovely, but the bonus was the beautiful balcony with views of the Eiffel Tower. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would highly recommend this hotel. We hope to make a return trip before too long!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zorro466
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and will definitely stay there again. This is a small hotel (< 60 rooms) in an ideal location in an upscale area of the city. The neighborhood was filled with good restaurants, cute shops and close to the metro. All of the staff at the hotel were very friendly and eager to help - outstanding service! The rooms were clean and the bathrooms appear to have been recently updated. Continental breakfast is included and they will bring it to your room if you prefer not to eat in the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience - 1st trip to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Jo J
Reviews.Content: The West End Hotel was lovely, we paid a little extra to stay in an Executive room which was very nicely appointed. The staff were very helpful and breakfast each morning was very nice. The West End Hotel is extremely well located with a 5 minute walk to Champs Elysee and the many restaurants nearby. We travelled around Paris on the Hop On, Hop Off Tourist Bus which we could catch near the Arc De Triomphe. I could not fault my first stay in Paris (just that it was too short), we will definately be back and would love to stay at the West End again! Thank you for making my first experience so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A cosy winter break”
Reviews.Author: TheWilyFox
Reviews.Content: Spent a winter weekend break here and found the hotel to be lovely. Had used Tripadvisor to research it and was not disappointed. Very clean and comfortable with friendly, helpful staff. Located very centrally with all forms of transport close to hand. Everything we needed to complement a few days of relaxation and sightseeing. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo T
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very good services and location. The chambre luxe is very good. The only problem is the noise from the street, specially for the lowest rooms. In the morning, the laundry is very noisy. They really need a double window. Prefer the highest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfectly beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaFreckles
Reviews.Content: In 1970, my last visit to Paris, I stayed in a small hotel called Round Point and vowed to return there if I was ever lucky enough to visit again. Skip ahead 40 years, two kids, 3grand kids and I was finally able to introduce my husband to the most beautiful city I've ever seen. To my disappointment I could not locate the Round Point. So after searching every available avenue, I asked my travel agent to find a small hotel, at least 3 stars in a good location. Oh my! He delivered the West-End Hotel. We were the first of his clients to stay at this perfect small hotel in the heart of the designer shopping district. There is nothing I would change about our experience there. A breakfast was included,but we never took advantage of it because the bed was so comfy. We could walk to all the major sites, but we also could have stayed in the neighborhood and had an amazing time. Up the street is a beautiful bakery and on the corner a block up is a wonderful cafe that served the best lamb I have ever eaten. Across the street from the cafe was a magnificent Asian restaurant, We traveled to Paris from Venice over night on the train so we were very tired. The hotel accommodated us by allowing an early check-in. At dusk we walked to the Chinese restaurant. My husband was seated across from me. Over his right shoulder was a magnificent view of the Eiffel Tower. When darkness fell and the tower began twinkling, I told him to turn around and look. He was instantly in love with Paris! From shopping to eating to site seeing this hotel made everything exceptionally easy. I can't wait to return and I won't wait 40 years this time. Thank you West-End Hotel for the romance we found in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ediesontour
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere special to stay in Paris over the Christmas holidays and settled on Hotel West End based on the rating and reviews from Tripadvisor. The cost of the rooms was quite high, but we did not want to compromise as we had not been away from home at Christmas as a family before and wanted it to be special. Prior to our trip we contacted the hotel to arrange a dinner reservation for Christmas day as the hotel does not have its own restaurant. We found all of the staff that we dealt with very helpful and the restaurant chosen, La Fermette Marbeuf (just down the road) was excellent. The rooms were very comfortable and clean, especially the superior room we had to book for the boys to get a twin. The breakfast was served late into the morning which was great as the boys are not early risers. The breakfast room was small, but the choice was good, as was the service. The location was ideal for the Champs Elysees and the Eifel Tower (which we could see from our balcony, if you craned you craned your neck) and a short walk from a number of Metro stations. Overall we had a very pleasant stay for the three nights of our trip and would probably consider going back again if were considering another special trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel in a great neighbourhood.”
Reviews.Author: Hayches
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel in a great safe location. The room was very quaint, clean and the bathroom was beautiful. The staff were very accommodating and made our stay very enjoyable. My wife and I walked to numerous locations from the hotel like the eiffel tower, champs-elysees, and arc de triomphe. We also would just walk around and find fantastic cafes and restaurants anywhere around the hotel. You are close to the Metro which makes it easy to get anywhere in Paris. Would highly recommend the hotel, great value for the $.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: flyflybutterfly1
Reviews.Content: Quick stay for 1 night on a work trip -room was compact but lovely and tres chic! -Room service was delicious -Staff were just lovely, nothing too much trouble and ever so helpful in getting me back to the airport very early morning -Didn't have time for breakfast so can't comment on that. -Location was superb, first time to Paris and I felt very much at the heart of things. Also felt very safe at night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Liam M
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the West-End Hotel. I proposed to my now fiancée whilst in Paris and this Hotel was perfect for us. The staff and management are so friendly and upgraded us to the top floor where we had a fantastic view to the Eiffel Tower from our balcony. It made our stay feel so romantic and special. The room itself was lovely and clean and felt very Parisian in style. The Hotel also sourced special bread for my fiancée as she is wheat intolerant. This was a fantastic touch as they really didn't have to do this for us. The location is perfect and it feels like a very safe, quiet, upmarket area within easy walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, Champs-Elysees and many other attractions. This is a perfect place for couples on a romantic break. Can not recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AoifeandPeter
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay here in November. We booked a standard room, which was very roomy and tastefully decorated. The hotel has a lovely ambiance, with candles lighting in the lobby. The location was perfect, it was within walking distance of all the sights, and close to metro stations for further out attractions. Would love to go back again

Reviews.Title: “A lovely one night stay”
Reviews.Author: CandJ_Burgess
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Paris for our 2 year anniversary (my wife had never been to Paris before) and after looking through several websites decided that the Hotel West End was both within budget and within the location I wanted. The staff at the hotel were both friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them. The room was excellent. A good size with a comfy bed and lovely bathroom. No view to speak of but we weren't planning on spending lots of time looking out of the window! As other people have said, the breakfast room was a little on the small side but, the food was fresh and to a high standard. Overall, both my wife and I thought that the hotel was lovely and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Colshorrock
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here and it really is a great little hotel in a great location. Very friendly and helpful staff, the room was spacious, clean, a good bed and a clean and roomy bathroom. Good wifi, breakfast a little cramped sometimes as the hotel was busy and the coffee could have been better. Within walking distance to all the right sights, would definitely stay again and recommend anyone else to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The location and staff are great.”
Reviews.Author: Boisvert5
Reviews.Content: I've been in and out of Paris 2 to 3 times a year since 2002. For the last 5 years at the West End. This being my base, I come and go for a few days, the staff understands the travelers needs and will accommodate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barbelle25
Reviews.Content: My mum & I stayed for a few days in September & would recommend this hotel. It is very clean & the staff are friendly. The room was nicely decorated & was a fine size as you never get vast rooms in Paris. Best of all was the location though as so much of the city was in walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: VittorioRullo
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience there Staff is naturally very nice and helpful Location is great...just 2 blocks from Champs Elysees, but in small and very quiet street Breakfast and Wi-Fi included Rooms could be a little bigger, but definitely great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Location, front desk, and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: A G
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 days in Paris at this hotel. The location is fabulous, close to wonderful restaurants and a 3 block walk to the Champs. The front desk was so helpful, especially when my luggage did not arrive with my plane. The WiFi was great. The bathroom was huge and the best of my stay in the country.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property. Okay location.”
Reviews.Author: everett_rainier
Reviews.Content: Traveling with my wife. This was our first stay in Paris. For a place like Paris (assuming it's like London and New York), the hotel was great. Breakfast and wifi were included with the room. The room itself was a little on the small side, but not too small, had a balcony from which we could see the Eiffel Tower, and a marble-tiled bathroom. The staff was very helpful and brought an ironing board and voltage transformer promptly at my request. Negatives: didn't love the location (not especially convenient to the Metro) and the shower could've used a new showerhead. Otherwise, it was a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris / excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Milo B
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time in Paris and in West End Hotel. They've made our trip even more special, as we arrived earlier around 10.30am and had our room ready for use. The staff was very professional and everyone was welcoming and nice. The hotel and decoration inside is beautiful, you can really feel that you in 4* Hotel. Just 5mins. walk to Champs Elysees and around 15mins. to Eiffel Tower. We were very satisfied, you get what you pay for. Very good value!!!

Reviews.Title: “good place small and cosy”
Reviews.Author: Muxu
Reviews.Content: nice small hotel Very confortable Little concerns, for the price: - they could improve the breakfast :having fresh orange juice, scrumble eggs without additional fees.... - free wifi access

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: ectphd
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days with five rooms for a family wedding. Had stayed in a chain hotel in London before coming to Paris. What a difference the Hotel West End turned out to be. Small, intimate, and very comfortable decor. Breakfast was included; one of the better Continental breakfast set ups I have seen. Two factors truly set this hotel apart. The staff is not only proficient and helpful, but pleasant, engaging, and personable. So, you feel welcome and appreciated. Second, the location is exceptional. It is situated within a triangle bounded by the hustle and bustle and high end attractions and shopping of Avenue George V, the Champs Elysees, and Avenue Montaigne, but on a quiet side street. An oasis. Many quality small restaurants within a few blocks. E Taylor

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - clean - friendly”
Reviews.Author: shanodot
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The room was spotless, the staff was friendly and spoke very good English, and it was charming. The only complaint for me was the bed was very firm but many people like a firm bed. I just don't. There are hotels all around the Champs Elysees that are much more expensive and luxurious, but this one was just fine and by no means "budget" level.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up on this great hotel in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: Tlion
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful hotel. My first time out of the country and I brought my 13 year old daughter with me. Needless to say - safety, cleanliness etc were of huge concern to a Mom and daughter. I could not have picked a better hotel. Location was fabulous! With a Police station across the street, pharmacy 1 block away, market 2 blocks away, post office 1 block away, Metro 4-5 blocks and short walks to Arc, Champs-Elyse and the Tower - we had everything we needed. It definitely felt like our "home" in Paris. The staff was wonderful. VERY clean....thank goodness. ( I am picky) Breakfast was great. It is located in the most awesome spot with all these things close by and it was still the most quiet hotel I think I ever stayed at. Huge two thumbs up on this hotel!!! This hotel made my stay in Paris PERFECT!!

Reviews.Title: “Both Elegant and Charming”
Reviews.Author: escondida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the West End for 4 days this past May, but were treated as frequent guests starting with our arrival! Always recognized by name or room by all members of staff, we felt very special. All we had to do was ask, and arrangements were made for trips or metro directions. Our room was well appointed and had a delightful view of our street and the top of the Eiffel Tower. The location is wonderful. Breakfasts were "complete continental" and the baked goods were delicious. I woke up each morning with coffee delivered to our room prior to breakfast. This gave me a wonderful opportunity to plan the day and just soak up the view from our Juliette balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Simply magical!”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix85
Reviews.Content: I was taken here for a surprise 40th birthday present weekend away. This hotel was like a dream come true! From the moment we stepped foot inside the cool and immaculate reception, we were welcomed with warmth and professionalism by every member of the team. Nothing was too much trouble, every request for assistance was met with a friendly, helpful response. The hotel is spotlessly clean, our room was beautifully decorated and furnished and our tiny balcony overlooked a quiet street. If I had tried to describe my perfect weekend away, this would have been it. We ate breakfast at the hotel but dined elsewhere during the day. The food was exactly as you'd expect - a mix of croissants and pastries, cereals, yoghurts, fruit, muesli and other items. There was even a tiny bowl of chocolate fish on Easter day! The bathroom was spotlessly clean and well equipped, with a bath and two shower attachments. Hot water every time we needed it too! There was a hairdryer and shaver socket and plenty of clean towels and toiletries. Location-wise the hotel is perfect. You are within walking distance of the Champs Elysee and Eiffel Tower. The river is easily accessible and there are plenty of restaurants nearby. The staff will happily call a taxi if you need one and they even booked our celebratory meal for us at our chosen brasserie (I was also surprised by a proposal whilst there so we had lots to be happy about!). I would love to return to this hotel and cannot recommend it highly enough. It is simply magical!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant indeed”
Reviews.Author: Gary M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights in February ’11. Based in a posh and expensive looking part of Paris very close to the Champs Elysees and about a 15-minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. Even though it is in quite a posh location you didn’t feel out of place. It is a very clean hotel. The reception staff are pleasant and all spoke English. The hotel seems to have a nice laid-back atmosphere. The breakfast room is tiny as other reviews report, 16 tables in 4 blocks of 4 but we didn’t have a problem. The breakfast choice is croissant, cereal, yogurt, fruit and juice. The coffee wasn’t so great, slightly burnt taste but nothing to complain about. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel - Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: travelchick123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this fantastic hotel for 12 days and from the moment we arrived were welcomed by a friendly, warm staff who were more than happy to help us with anything needed. Even prior to arrival, they promptly answered many questions via email. Nothing was too much trouble - arranging cars to/from airport, helping us with a problem confirming a flight home, recommending great shopping, dining - anything at all! The hotel is charming, the rooms are beautiful and very clean and in a fabulous neighborhood. We are already planing a trip back to Paris and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel in fashionable 8th arrondisement”
Reviews.Author: czarina21
Reviews.Content: We are frequent visitors to Paris and wanted to stay in a part of town we had never stayed in before. We also wanted to try one of the smaller hotels rather than a large international chain (we often stay at the Intercontinental near the Opera). The West End was recommended to us by a friend and we could not have been more pleased with it. We booked a deluxe room, and were given a large lovely one on the corner with a balcony. The decor made us feel like we were in Paris, the beds and pillows were comfortable, and the bathroom was roomy. Everything was very clean. Our stay included a continental breakfast, which is rare in Paris these days. The breakfast room is small so we had it delivered to our room. It arrived within five minutes of ordering it. The staff was friendly and helpful. If I had to suggest two things to the management, they would be to make sure the towels put in each room are not threadbare, as one of ours was. The other would be to provide free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great small Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: morristNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: This hotel's staff speaks English perfectly; has nice (included) buffet breakfast; rooms are small (but not tiny) and tastefully furnished. Helpful friendly staff. Very clean; "old world" hotel on a quiet street just off the Champs Ellissey, great location,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- very well located”
Reviews.Author: MrHunnybun
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Paris many times but this is the first time we have stayed at the Hotel West End. It is situated in a very good location, about five minutes walk from the Champs Elysses and Avenue George V. The surrounding streets are full of interesting boutiques, shops and other hotels. The double room was relatively small but was very clean. There was a TV with some English channels and iPod docks for charging/playing music. The only minor point I was disappointed by was our room not having any kettle or tea-making facilities. Breakfast was included and we took it in the breakfast room downstairs. This was crowded as it is quite a small room. However, the service was excellent as was the food The staff were attentive and whilst understanding (just about) my schoolboy French spoke in very good English. I'll be back in Paris in 2011 and will be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, quiet, clean, modern ammenities fused with old decor”
Reviews.Author: ajgincanada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this charming little hotel for our honeymoon. This is a centrally located boutique hotel, tucked into a small, quiet side-side-side street. We were pleasantly surprised to get a room with a lovely balcony and a view of the top of the Eiffel tower even though we only booked a basic room. The room itself was reasonably spacious for what it was, relative to European hotels... don't go to Europe for spacious hotel rooms unless you have thousands of dollars to spare! The hotel staff was polite except for one female receptionist who I had a feeling may have had a bit of a chip on her shoulder and was a bit unfriendly with my husband and I, possibly because of our age, in our upper 20s we were by far the youngest to stay at the hotel. She made a few snide remarks a couple of times. The other receptionists (male) were kind, helpful, and polite. The hotel staff speaks fluent English. Even though we are from Quebec and speak fluent French, detecting our accent they still switched to English for us at times. Breakfast was delicious: it had all the basics including fresh pastries and baguettes with gourmet jam and honey, juice, fruit, pound cake, tea or absolutely delicious coffee (I suggest the cafe au lait...still have dreams about it!), yogurt, cereal. The rooms have ipod docks which were handy (no need to bring your charger on the plane) and nice flat screen tvs. They also have small mini-fridges which we were able to store some sandwiches and salads in from local grocery stores instead of having to eat every meal out. Overall I was impressed by the cleanliness, comfort of the bed and the rooms, the balcony with a table and chairs and the view. You can't ask for much more in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “The best little boutique hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: melbur
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night as we were enroute to pick up our cruise in Copenhagen, and decided a visit to Paris would be fun. We weren't disappointed. This is the most adorable property and the location is fantastic - within walking distance to all you would want to see. The walk to the Louvre area is a bit far but beautiful if you can do it. The Eiffel Tower and Arc Triomphe are very close by. We stayed in a superior room, rooms are not large but certainly big enough for the two of us. Our room had a sweet little balcony too, standing room only. Super clean and comfortable. They also offered a continental breakfast, which we chose to have in our room as the breakfast room is quite small. Would absolutely stay here again when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could wish for in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Offthetreadmill
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located within strolling distance of restaurants, shopping and sight-seeing. Excellent friendly and helpful service from all staff, clean, comfortable room and good breakfast. We thought it was very good value given location and service and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: KiwiLisa1006
Reviews.Content: Positives: Large spacious room (we booked the deluxe room) Great location, safe area Friendly helpful staff Clean rooms (apart from the fleas, see below) Basic breakfast was included in the price Negatives: Very noisey room, was woken every morning (between 5am and 7am) by delivery trucks to the hotel. Late at night there were alot of people walking around the street below which you could hear clearly. In the morning the room cleaning lady came around about 7.30-8am, which meant no sleep in's as even if you put a 'do not disturb' sign on the door, you could still hear her cleaning the other rooms (vacuuming, banging round etc) as the walls were so thin. You could hear other guests in their rooms also. Limited choices on the room service menu - when we tried to order we were told what we wanted wasn't available, so we chose something else, which wasn't available either. The food that was finally available to order was not very nice. I was bitten quite badly by fleas (or bed bugs?) on the first 2 nights of our stay which wasn't plesant to have red itchy bites all over while on holiday. The bed was hard and lumpy, which caused my back to ache the whole time of our stay. So what with the noise, the terrible bed and the early starts of the room cleaning, sleeping was an issue at this hotel for me. The breakfasts had a good selection of food choices if you ate it in the painfully quiet small crowded breakfast room downstairs, but if you wanted to eat in your room (which was encouraged), you had to pay extra for things like yoghurt, fruit and cereals, which were 'free' downstairs. Only pastries, buns and tea/coffee was included if ordered to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Paris West-End Hotel was perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: tcuprincess430
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paris Hotel West-End August 26th-August 30th, and it was perfect for us. The location of this hotel cannot be beat! Rue Clement Marot is a quiet little street in the middle of all the action- nestled between Ave Montaigne and Ave George V- I can't believe this hotel was so affordable. Ave Montaigne has all the best luxury stores- Prada, Gucci, Louis Vuitton, Versace, Harry Winston... and Ave George V is home to the Paris Four Seasons... The Fouquets Barrier hotel is also right around the corner. Hotel West End was situated right next to all the best Paris has to offer for a fraction of the price of other hotels. All the major sights are within walking distance. We walked to the Arc De Triomphe, The Grand and Petit Palais, the Plaza de Concorde and Tuilleries Garden. We had lunch at cafes on the Champs-Elysees every day. The bank of the Seine River is just a short stroll down Ave Montaigne. We booked an executive level room (Room 503) and our room had a wrap around balcony with a panoramic view, I think it must have been the best room in the hotel. We could see the top of the Eiffel Tower and enjoyed watching it sparkle at night from the privacy of our balcony. The room was big by European standards, and had 4 large window/doors that opened to the balcony. The bathroom was nice with a lot of counter space. The bath tub had a wall-mounted shower head as well as a separate hand-held shower head. (The tub was elevated pretty high and some travelers with mobility issues might have a hard time getting in and out, but it wasn't a problem for us) The bathroom even had a really great hair dryer! I'm wary of relying on hotel hair dryers and this one was powerful and worked like a charm. The staff at the front desk was always friendly and accommodating. We were there celebrating our 5th anniversary and the receptionist arranged to have our room filled with flowers and rose petals at the spur of the moment. The breakfast buffet was always fresh and a great way to save a few Euros every day. The internet access wasn't free, but it was very reasonable. I think we paid 10 euro for 6 hours of access which was really all we needed. Overall, the Paris West End hotel is charming. It's a beautiful facility, intimate and quiet, but right in the middle of where you want to be. The streets around the hotel are lined with cafes, bars and pharmacies. It was very easy to navigate the city from this hotel and it was a real bargain for it's location. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again. Thank you, West End Hotel for making our trip to Paris so fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, perfect, perfect....”
Reviews.Author: Eugenia85
Reviews.Content: Great location, near the Triumf Arc and Pont d'Alma. 15 minutes by walk till the Eiffel Tower. Friendly staff, clean and full room, tasty breakfast. Would like to say, that the hotel has best location for Paris exloring.

Reviews.Title: “top notch location & great value”
Reviews.Author: Magnum55
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a block from Rue Montaigne, and the Champs d'Elysees and the Eiffel Tower are a short walk away. As far as Paris hotels go the room was quite spacious and the bathroom was big by any standards. Our room had a little balcony which was a nice touch. The hotel offers a complimentary continental breakfast but the breakfast room is small. Ordering it to your room is a great option. The front dest was helpful and made sure to ask to see our room to make sure we were guests when we returned late at night. For the price and location this hotel is an excellent value and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL STAY”
Reviews.Author: meteortel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from April 10 to April 21 and I could not have been happier with our choice. We got caught up iin the ash cloud chaos and the hotel let us stay for a few extra nights. We though we would be charged alot more but they gave us a special rate. The staff there is AMAZING!! They are so helpful. If you need any advice where to go or directions alway ask at the front desk. Our room was always clean and surprisingly spacious for a Paris hotel. The location couldn't have been better, you are close to everything. They provided breakfast and it was great. We opted to have ours in our room because their breafst room is pretty smal. So they would bring it to us every morning, no problem. You can prchase a internet card for relatively cheap and it lasted us all week. I highly recomment this hotel to anyone going to Paris, you won't be dissapointed. We will stay there again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: my0000
Reviews.Content: I am glad we decided to stay at Hotel West-End. The room is very nice and clean. The location is fantastic, minutes from Tour Eiffel and Arc de Triomphe. The hotel staff is very friendly but I will skip the restaurant recommendation. The breakfast is great, high quality. but the room they used to server breakfast is small. I highly recommend this hotel for it's value, service and location. I wish they offer free internet connection. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good value and super location”
Reviews.Author: Indichur
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westend for two nights and I have to say, taking into account the fact that it is Paris and the location, it was a very good value. Lovely done rooms and the staff went out of their way to be helpful - be it a simple taxi request or a super-last-minute reservation to a posh restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, breakfast in bed encouraged, great location!”
Reviews.Author: pips28
Reviews.Content: We had a standard room in the westend which was bigger than most paris hotel rooms, we had our own balcony, bathroom with bath and plasma tv. The room and hotel is decorated in a classy french style with candles and flowers everywhere. The hotel is quiet, conviently located off a very stylish shopping st (dior, channel and harry winston are around the corner). It takes about 5 mins to walk to the champs elysee, 15 mins to the eiffel tower and 25 to the louvre along the beautiful seine. 2 well connected metro stops are 5 mins walk away. the hotel serves continnental and hot breakfast and encourages you to have it in bed at no extra cost! alternatively there is a buffet breakfast room downstairs. Staff are very friendly and helpful! Highly reccomended for price location and style! ps. our room rate including breakfast was 189 euro per night but this was on valentines weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: docswimmy
Reviews.Content: I was forced to stay in this hotel because the hotel de Sers overbooked. Yes, the deluxe rooms are clean and spacy. And yes, the people are kind. But the official price of €449 per night in a deluxe room is to high, considering the available services: only payed WiFi, no restaurant, limited breakfast capacities (you're encouraged to take breakfast in your room, since the breakfast room has only 5 tables; limited breakfast choice with a lot of payed extra's), limited room service, etc. Overall, not enough value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little boutique hotel a couple of blocks away from major attractions”
Reviews.Author: fattibumba
Reviews.Content: This review is well overdue - my husband and I went to Paris for our honeymoon and stayed at Westend hotel for 5 nights for NYE08. This place is a nice little boutique hotel 2 or 3 blocks away from Champs d'Elise. Reception - tastefully decorated, small but cosy and inviting. Reception staff spoke very good english and during the 5 days we stayed at the hotel, we only had to deal with 2 or 3 different people as the hotel is really small and they normally had 1 or 2 people at the reception. The gentleman at the front desk was pleasant and polite and provided us with sufficient information when we asked for directions etc. The reception also organised our tickets to see the crazy horse show and were very helpful. By the way, do not go to see Crazy Horse, it was so boring my husband and I fell asleep. Room - We stayed in the basic room which was really tiny but I must say it was clean and newly renovated/decorated. The bathroom was again very small but all new fittings and marble tiles so it was pleasant. I looked at over 50 different hotels in Paris before deciding on this place. The main reasons for choosing Westend hotel was based on price, location and pictures and reviews I had seen from tripadvisor. Bathroom and cleanliness are the two major things I look for in an accommodation and this place fit the bill. Although it wasn't cheap by any means, it was cheaper than many other places that looked worn and old with 4/5 stars. We had a small balcony which we basically used as a fridge as it was very cold outside. We could also see the Eiffel tower in the distance from the balcony. They had a little Ipod docking station which came in handy. The bed was a little small as it was only a double bed. I think they call it a queen size bed but it was much smaller than our bed at home. The heating was great in the room and overall we were happy with this hotel. Continental breakfast was included in the price which included all the pastries, cereal, fruit salad, tea and coffee. They have the most gorgeous croissants and we stocked up on breakfast as we walked absolutely everywhere. The Metro station is only a 5 min walk away but there's so much to see that you can miss a lot if you don't do Paris by foot. The down sides to this hotel are: 1. All the restaurants and cafes near by are very very expensive as it's in a ritzy part of Paris. 2. It's not close to a supermarket so we ended up stocking up on drinks/snacks during the day when we were in other parts of Paris and brought it back with us. 3. The elevator in the hotel can only fit 2 -3 people max - it is sooo small. But it has beautiful stairs and we stayed on the 3rd floor so I walked up and down to burn off the pastries. We only saw 3 other people during our stay so we didn't have to share the lift most of the time. 4. They only have one computer for internet. You have to buy the internet card from reception and it was really expensive. The computer didn't work for a few days during our stay so we didn't even get to use up our credit. This area as I said is very ritzy so if you want the small streets with markets and cheaper eateries, the south side of the river is better. We ended up spending a lot more time in St Germain as there were a lot more things that we were interested in like boutique shops and restaurants. Overall, it was a nice hotel to stay at and we really loved the breakfasts at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel ,excellent location”
Reviews.Author: marwan1975
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in this hotel in april 2009 for four nights,it was perfect. our room was large,comfortable,alwayes clean,bathroom was luxurious. location is unbeatable,calm and safe area,close to everything. gentlemen on the front desk were very nice and helpful,they arranged all our tours,helped us with directions and recommended one good nearby restaurent. may be the only disadventage was the small beakfast room,and poor breakfast which is usual inmost of paris hotels. it is really highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: doghole
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have stayed in Paris for the money and will only stay here from now on.This is my sixth trip to Paris and the hotel made it the most enjoyable. We arrived from Australia after 24 hours travelling the staff had a room ready for us. Sam the porter offered us breakfast which I didnt want but brought me a coffee as requested. Marcia the lady on the front desk is so helpful , restaurant bookings , taxis etc even remembered my wifes birthday. Then Djemil the night manager what a friendly helpful fellow.We had room 209 huge for Paris standards , double marble bathroom, very comfortable and quiet. Breakfast is very good and the hotel is in a great location. We have found our Paris hotel.Wish I found it 10 years ago. Very personal I dont like the big chains.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service! Friendly staff! Lovely french hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FiftySomething50
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a small lovely french 4 star hotel in a great location and that is exactly what the WestEnd is. We stayed 3 Nights in a Deluxe room with 2 balconies! It was a very good size room and very comfortable and clean.Large walk in wardrobe lovely bathroom with bath and shower ( a little tight for space but not a problem) Room service was excellent and standard breakfast (which is included in room price) delivered to room for no extra cost is very good value which is rare in Paris at the moment. Our visit was for a special anniversary and the staff were very helpful and freindly if we needed advice, taxis and places to eat etc and were especially helpful in making our anniversary a special day. Great Location lots of local places to eat within a few minutes walking distance and the Champs Elysees is only a few streets away. We walked to the Louvre and the Eiffel tower from here but also used the open top red bus which is a brilliant way to get around especially on a short stay. We took a champagne tasting cruise down the river which was very romantic and also went to the Moulin Rouge for dinner and the show. We were not impressed with the food but the show really was fun and entertaining. We will certainly return to this hotel next time we go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Bigger isn't always better: a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: kingsway09
Reviews.Content: Myself and my sixteen year old daughter stayed at the Hotel West-End and really enjoyed it. All of our worries about safety, cleanliness, and confusion in a hotel dissolved. It was our first trip to Europe and the people at the Westend hotel really made it a wonderful and easy experience. The front desk was helpful and patient with us and our ignorance of the city. They gave good reccomendations and advice on restaurants and were more than willing to help us out in difficult situations. We received personal and intimate attention that other places sometimes lack. The room was spacious and very clean. We still had all of the modern electronics and luxuries along with the feeling of the classic Paris charm. Our room had a balcony which we received upon request. It was nice to go outside and watch the neighborhood activity, but still feel like you were in a safe place. The marble bathroom was very clean and had both a shower and a bath tub. It was updated with a lighted make- up mirror, two sinks, provided bath products, and a hair dryer. The air conditioning was not a problem as we believed it would be. The controls worked very well and our room was always kept cool and comfortable. We really liked that the closet had a lot of room and was equipped with shelves and an easy access safe. The beds were comfortable as well and always had nice clean sheets. My daughers favorite part was the old-fashioned key to the room. Very unique and a charming touch. The breakfast room was very nice and quaint. It included a free continental breakfast. The food was delicious, especially the croissants, and the service was great. It was a quick and easy way to start off your day. The location of the hotel was very desirable. It was only a few blocks off the the Champs-Elysees or a half a block away from Avenue Montaigne(which is like the Fifth Avenue of Paris). The hotel was not far away from wonderful restaurants, the Arc de Triomph, or various metro stops. We were close to many things, but weren't in the center of all the crowds and tourists. The Hotel West-End was perfect for our first time in Paris. Everyone understood English, which was the biggest relief for us. We really enjoyed our week in Paris, and it was nice to return to such a nice hotel after the days adventure was over. Beautiful hotel, good service, endless memories. Jeff and Tayler Strauch, Pennsylvania

Reviews.Title: “Inflated value; discourteous service”
Reviews.Author: pln61
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel West End Paris to be very disappointing on multiple levels. First, the few good points: our "executive" room was relatively spacious compared to other hotels in Paris where we have stayed over the the years and came with a cute balcony overlooking rue Clement Marot, but it also did cost us more, at their "promotion" rate of 279 Euros per night. The continental breakfasts for 2 were included in the price and were plentiful with a good variety including fresh fruits; the gentleman overseeing the breakfast room was polite and attentive. The ladies at the reception desk were uniformly polite and helpful (please see below regarding the rude men at the reception desk). The location was great with numerous good bistrots and restaurants nearby as well as several fashion powerhouses. Negative: Room: for a hotel which bills itself as sophisticated and for the rates that it commands, we were rather disgusted that the some of the bathroom amenities were partially filled with water (or some clear liquid) to make them look full, but the colorless water-like liquid was rather clearly demarcated from the colored shampoo or bath gel -- petty and crude! The plumbing in the bathroom was substandard and required multiple flushings for rather simple and straightforward operations. We have to assume that the towels were clean but we also noted that all had an odd grey color, suggesting that it might be time for management to consider a new supply of towels or perhaps simply bleach. There were no face towels, bathrobes, or slippers -- for an "executive" room??? Service: We were most appalled by the rude service rendered by the men at the reception desk. At check-in, after I introduced myself, one man told me how my name is pronounced in French, except for the obvious fact that it's NOT a French name by any stretch of one's imagination. He next proceeded to instruct his colleagues with a great deal of sarcastic fanfare how my name should be pronounced. Frankly, I don't care how it's pronounced by a hotel reception clerk, hence the silleness of this entire incident which the man single-handedly instigated. Oh, and he insisted to conduct this entire affair in French, which I obliged, whereas the woman at the desk during the same time period asked more houghtfully if I would prefer to communicate in French or in English. The next morning, a different man at the reception desk told me that my taxi which I had asked the desk to arrange for a 9AM pick-up was not there yet because it wasn't 9AM yet, except for the fact that the woman at the desk at the same time must have been using a different clock, since she thought that it was in fact already nine and proposed that we went ahead with the taxi that was already there! And of course, throughout this entire episode, the man spoke French whereas the woman spoke English. As if to emphasize that this was neither an issue with an individual staff member nor a training issue, the supervisor -- a yet different man-- who walked by the breakfast room in the morning did not even make eye contact, smile, or offer a simple greeting to any of his guests -- hardly a role model for best customer service! We had picked this hotel mostly for convenience. We had a one-night stopover in Paris on our way back to the US from Tunisia and wanted to stay somewhere close to the Theatre des Champs Elysees for a concert there that evening, and also to be able to access the Air France airport bus to CDG for our flights. In that sense, the location worked out well. Otherwise, this hotel masquerades as a classy operation but is instead petty with poor values, and its male staff needs to be either re-trained, or else Hotel West End should make very clear the kind of customers whom it does or does not serve, or whether it has instructed its male staff to carry on the caricature of snooty and rude customer service in France of long ago. No business engaged in the hospitality industry should take money from its clients if it is not able to treat its clients with a modicum of courtesy. We travel to Europe frequently both for business and for personal purposes and have never minded the cost if the businesses make a reasonable effort to earn it. We have enjoyed our stays at other hotels in Paris as well as as other parts of France and have never encountered this kind of operation. Shame on Hotel West End!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Boutique Hotel Located btw The Eiffel Tower & Arc D'Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: shasta3130
Reviews.Content: We booked this charming boutique hotel online for the price we'd expect to pay at a Radisson. Our rooms had more storage space than our home apartment does! Excellent location very close to the Champs D'Elysses. The first room had a HUGE marble bathroom with dual sinks, gigantic tub, separate shower, and a detached toilet. The second room had a walk-in closet and fully accessible balcony. Everything was clean and there were ample toiletries, a hairdryer and, and iPod speaker/charger. The beds were comfy but the TVs were small and included two English-speaking channels. Mini bar, WiFi, and dry cleaning available for a fee. Daily breakfast was served free until 11am - coffee, juice, croissants, fruit, yogurt, toast, muesli. Cute foyer with comfy chairs, handpicked (although odd and ecclectic) artwork throughout, one tiny elevator for all 6 (?) floors. Staff spoke several languages and were very helpful: early check-in, taxi requests, dinner reservations, baggage storage. I will definitely tell my friends about this place!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: didoooz
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights, in this boutique hotel, and I have to say it was a very good experience. Location is ideal footsteps away from the Champs elysee, George V, Montaigne or the Tour Eiffel. Staff extremly friendly, and breakfast with no additional charge. Rooms are spacious compared to room sizes in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and value”
Reviews.Author: Chic80
Reviews.Content: I looked long and hard for a hotel, which offered fantastic value. for money The West End Hotel is THAT hotel. The staff were very friendly. Nothing was too much bother. The hotel has a fantastic atmosphere and is brilliantly situated close to all the sites. I would recommend it. I had booked 2 rooms and both were well decorated and very clean.

HotelInfo.Name: West-End Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 7 rue Clement Marot, 75008 Paris, France
